node.title: Error using mpiexec
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I wrote a coupled THM code using MOOSE and it works fine on a single core, but when I want to run it in multicore using "mpiexec", I get this error:
mpiexec -n 4 ./frozen_soil_thm -i ./problems/THMTests4_coupled_verification/input.i
[proxy:0:0@Kians-MacBook-Air.local] HYDU_create_process (utils/launch/launch.c:73): execvp error on file ./frozen_soil_thm (No such file or directory)
[proxy:0:0@Kians-MacBook-Air.local] HYDU_create_process (utils/launch/launch.c:73): execvp error on file ./frozen_soil_thm (No such file or directory)
[proxy:0:0@Kians-MacBook-Air.local] HYDU_create_process (utils/launch/launch.c:73): execvp error on file ./frozen_soil_thm (No such file or directory)
[proxy:0:0@Kians-MacBook-Air.local] HYDU_create_process (utils/launch/launch.c:73): execvp error on file ./frozen_soil_thm (No such file or directory)
This is a THM code and it wasn't an issue before adding the mechanical codes (when it was just a TH code) but now I'm getting this.
I would appreciate it if you could let me know what the problem might be.
Thanks.

You're getting this error because frozen_soil_thm does not exist. It shouldn't work in serial without mpi either.
Make sure you're in the right directory and make sure your application is compiled.
Thank you. Yes, it was a silly mistake!

node.title: Pre-splitting mesh not working with LowerDBlockFromSidesetGenerator
node.bodyText:
I am trying to pre-split a large mesh which involves LowerDBlockFromSidesetGenerator, however the process always segfaults whenever it begins writing files. An MWE command and input file are given at the bottom, along with the error message. Some observations:

Splitting works fine with other mixed-dimensional meshes (e.g. combined 3D cube and 2D rectangle).
Some of the files appear to write without issue before the segfault. My guess is these are sections of the mesh that don't contain the lower dimensional block.
I have tried "pre-generating" the mesh using --mesh-only, and splitting a .e file instead, but the issue persists.
This happens no matter how many pieces I split the mesh into, or how many processes/how much memory per process I allocate.

Any advice on how to work around this, or if there is likely to be a fix any time soon, would be much appreciated - thanks!
mpirun myapp-opt -i mesh.i --split-mesh 24 --split-file split.cpr

mesh.i
[Mesh]
  [cube]
    type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
    dim = 3
    nx = 10
    ny = 10
    nz = 10
  []
  [top]
    type = LowerDBlockFromSidesetGenerator
    input = cube
    sidesets = top
  []
[]



Error message
Splitting 24 ways...
    - writing 1 files per process...
Meta data are written into ./split.cpr/meta_data_mesh.rd.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Primary job  terminated normally, but 1 process returned
a non-zero exit code. Per user-direction, the job has been aborted.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
mpirun noticed that process rank xx with PID xxxx on node xxxx exited on signal 11 (Segmentation fault).
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

Thanks for providing the MWE and letting us know.
We'll debug this when possible
In the mean time, you ll have to use replicated meshes and use less processors to be able to fit the problem in memory
@GiudGiud has opened #25236 for this
Thanks for the response, will do

node.title: Encountered an error while compiling the MOOSE submodule in Molteres
node.bodyText:
Hi, developers.
I installed Molteres on an Ubuntu 20.04 server today.  After successfully downloading all the files, I compiled it using the "make -j8" command. The following errors occurred during the compilation process:

The following are the historical commands from my entire installation process, and I believe I did not make any mistakes:
    1  curl -L -O https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge/releases/latest/download/Mambaforge-Linux-x86_64.sh
    2  bash Mambaforge-Linux-x86_64.sh -b -p ~/mambaforge3
    3  export PATH=$HOME/mambaforge3/bin:$PATH
    4  mamba init
    5  exit
    6  conda config --add channels https://conda.software.inl.gov/public
    7  mamba install moose-tools moose-libmesh
    8  mkdir ~/projects
    9  cd ~/projects
   10  git clone https://github.com/arfc/moltres.git
   11  cd moltres
   12  git checkout master
   13  git submodule init
   14  git submodule update
   15  conda activate moose
   16  mamba activate moose
   17  mamba create -n moose moose-dev
   18  mamba activate moose
   19  mamba install moose-tools moose-libmesh
   20  make -j8
   21  history

I think it may be that MOOSE has made some updates that are not compatible with Moltres. When I separately compile the /framework folder in the MOOSE submodule in Moltres, this error also occurs. In addition, I downloaded and compiled MOOSE (excluding the Moltres section) according to the tutorials on the MOOSE official website, and the compilation and testing process of MOOSE was very smooth at this time.
In fact, I successfully installed Molteres and MOOSE in late March. So is there a way for me to use a Moose version from March as a submodule instead of the [Moose @ af38e9f(https://github.com/arfc/moltres)] , which is Moltres now using.
The error log is attached.
error_log.txt

You should try to update the moose submodule in moltres
go in moltres/moose, then
git fetch origin
Git checkout origin/devel
then
Cd ..
Make
OK, I'll give it a try now.
@smpark7 FYI

go in moltres/moose, then
git fetch origin
git checkout origin/devel

I think this is the proper way to fix my problem. And Moltres can be compiled successfully. Thanks for your help!
Thanks for the ping. Time to update the moose submodule

node.title: PorousFlow: how to set correct BC for boreholes
node.bodyText:
Dear community,
I am trying to set a TH model for a storage case using porous flow. I have read documentation like this but still need help. I made two cylinders in my mesh which are supposed to represent boreholes. The outer surface of one of the cylinders is also chosen as the BC for temperature. The material properties of the cylinders i.e. boreholes are selected in a way to represent a column on water (density=1000, porosity=1, ...). When I ran the simulation, only the outer boundary of the hot borehole heated up. In the following, you see some plots. The slice shows the hot area around the hot borehole while I expected it to heat up inside the borehole. Curves also pass through the section. As it can be seen the temperature value drops inside the borehole. The pressure behaves more normally and is increased in the borehole. My MOOSE input file and mesh are stored in my git repository at https://github.com/jack-fi/input_for_moose

I very much appreciate your help.

Hello
it seems unconventional to have dirichletBCs inside the domain. You will have better control over the amount of heat introduced using Neumann BCs
have you tried running this longer? I don’t know how much heat moves in 20s in the ground
Guillaume

I suspect @GiudGiud is correct and 20s isn't long enough to heat it up. Pressure propagates much faster than heat in a porous media, so it looks like what you are doing will work if you run it longer.
One comment is that the physics inside a borehole isn't really included in the porous flow module, and this physics is a bit different to flow in porous media, so I'm not sure how relevant your results will be?
Dear @cpgr and @GiudGiud Thanks for your hints and help.

node.title: Get closest node object to coordinates?
node.bodyText: Is there an efficient way to find the nearest Node object to some arbitrary (x,y,z) coordinates? Let's say I have some data that I want to associate with a node but all I have are arbitrary coordinates. I can probably get away with only needing to do this mapping once at startup (in my Kernel's initialSetup()) or once per timestep (timestepSetup()), so maybe efficiency isn't terribly important. I just worry about doing some $O\left(N\right)$ search on a model with millions of nodes.

Hello
if your node is in a known subdomain (even in the edge) you can use block restricted APIs on the mesh to find it.
The point locator object attached to a mesh can also find nodes quite efficiently, it won’t be that expensive if you know the coordinates and are looking for the node
Guillaume
Any framework examples I can take a look at to learn the syntax?

seems there is no subdomain-nodes loop on MeshBase but you can use that one:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/docs/doxygen/libmesh/classlibMesh_1_1MeshBase.html#ad3694fca532d45f4ad343ef66dfe2190
then use
        for (auto & elem_node : elem->node_ref_range())
        {

on the element
For the point locator it s this routine to get it:
mesh->sub_point_locator() (on the MeshBase, getMesh() from a MooseMesh)
and the docs for point locators to find nodes is here
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/docs/doxygen/libmesh/classlibMesh_1_1PointLocatorBase.html
Yeah - definitely don't use a subdomain node loop. Use the point locator and then compare nodes in the resulting element.

Looks like the PointLocatorBase class has a locate_node() method that will get me the Node directly  https://mooseframework.inl.gov/docs/doxygen/libmesh/classlibMesh_1_1PointLocatorBase.html#a70f85a0fc051b49344d55e8455d5d195
Only use that if you're confident that your data is at the nodes. Otherwise, you'll play with a game of tolerances

if the data is in the element near a node you can use the PL to find the element, then loop on the nodes.
I think we need more details here.
Is the object supposed to be at a node or near a node? and if near, within the elements sharing that node?
The data comes from an external program and serves to drive the nodal field variables (temperature etc.), so at the node or pretty darn close.

node.title: PorousFlow： Porosity setting
node.bodyText: Hello, how to set the porosity related to stress?

Hi,
I don't think this function is implemented in MOOSE. You have two options:
1.- You can code a new material object (with a bit of C++)
2.- If Residual and zero porosity and constant, you can use a ParsedFunction and pass the result to a AuxKernel and AuxVariable and use PorousFlowPorosityConst.
And probably a second ParsedFunction to compute the mean stress.

If you intend to solve for stress and porosity at the same time AND you are using AD, option 2 (with the functions) will not naturally propagate derivatives .
You will need to code the contributions to the Jacobian manually.
It seems there are porosity as a function of strain in the module, but not stress. @cpgr any suggestions on this?
If you need that relationship you will have to code a new porosity material yourself.

node.title: conditional control to switch preconditioner
node.bodyText:
Hi, is there a way to switch between two preconditioner blocks as a function of a variable extreme (minimum) value?
I'm aware of the test for switching between BCs:
modules/navier_stokes/test/tests/finite_volume/controls/switch-pressure-bc/test.i

but something similar does not seem to apply to the Preconditioning block
No on-the-fly switching of preconditioner blocks is not currently supported. I don't know if any of the discussion in #25063 would be of interest to you
Thanks!

This seems like a feature request.
I raised #25233

Many thanks @GiudGiud, as we can name blocks for different preconditioner blocks with just a "integer" number labels, would it work and is possible somehow to allow the use of a ParsedFunction [returning an integer, based on the extrema of a variable, taken from a postprocessor] within an fparse expression? I mean something as:
[Preconditioners]
active = ${fparse ${switch_function}}     # where the Function switch_function would return an integer
[0]
...
[]
[1]
...
[]
[]

We don’t support that syntax.
i think there s likely some non trivial petsc calls to make to switch preconditioners, we would probably look at supporting this with the Controls system first.
if you want to work on adding this we can support you. Otherwise you ll have to leverage the restart system to switch preconditioniers
Thanks! Was just a curiosity. Support via the Controls system would be just great!

node.title: Micro-mechanical-informed creep model
node.bodyText:
Hello everyone,
I would like to build the analytically homogenized creep model for lamellar structures.
The idea is to calculate stress using the anisotropic interaction law and the plastic strains inside the phases using radial return law.
If someone has an idea for starting point, I would be very greatful.
P.S. I have an experience in UMAT writing for Abaqus, maybe it would be a good idea to write UMAT instead of the modifying the MOOSE subroutines?

We do support UMAT in MOOSE too
@dschwen will guide you further

Thank you for the answer!
I find Materials in the TensorMechanics a little bit to convoluted and not so clear for understanding, maybe it would really an optimal solution to implement the UMAT instead of modification of existing MOOSE creep models

@RossMech
I have recently implemented a physics-based creep model by deriving from RadialReturnCreepStressUpdateBaseTempl,
see an example here:
https://github.com/ngrilli/c_pfor_am/blob/main/src/materials/SA508CreepStressUpdate.C
which is a simplification of the model in Lu et al. (2019) for ferritic steel.
Basically to create your own creep model you need to define a specific "creep_rate"
in the function computeResidualInternal
and its derivative with respect to Mises stress "creep_rate_derivative"
in the function computeDerivative

Hello everyone,
thank you for the answers. I would like to share my experience here with you.
As I said, the creep model was micro-mechanically informed. Therefore, the elastic stiffness should also be recalculated here. Therefore, I used computestress class and rewritten some of the methods there to implement my model.
Due to the incrporation of the tensor algebra features in RankTwoTensor and RankFourTensor methods, the implementation was much easier in comparison to UMAT programming (I personally can not bear the Voigt representation of stress, strain and stiffness tensors).
I would share more details as we get the research project and the publication done.
I would like to thank the community and the developers for such good tensor mechanics module infrastructure!

Hello
Thank you for the feedback. I'm sure @dschwen and @amjokisaari (and all the others involved in the development of these methods) will be happy to hear this.
Guillaume

node.title: Execute Shell Commands From MOOSE
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I am interested in running a Python script that performs calculations using simulation results after each time step. Subsequently, this Python script generates a CSV file, which in turn adjusts the boundary conditions within my simulation.
As the Python script can be executed via a terminal, I am wondering if it is currently possible to run execute shell commands from MOOSE.
Thanks in advance!
Jose

Hello
We unfortunately dont have this capability right now but it could be done in a user object with a bit of C++.
And we'd like to have this one day
@loganharbour for confirmation we dont have this
Guillaume

We don't have the capability. Execution paths that are introduced like this can be very difficult to test, therefore in most cases we'd rather develop a more framework-esque solution.
Something like this will coming soon for a specific funding need we have, but I'm still weary to using it in most cases

I d be fine with a RunCommandUO.
we can impose some constraints on what commands once we see what issues appear
Not sure if really need to capture pipe output. I guess if that's what you expect from your script it's fine.

Hi @GiudGiud,
my pipe between MOOSE and the shell appears to be functioning correctly. However, I am encountering issues when attempting to run it in parallel. The UserObject is being instantiated the same number of times as the number of cores I use for my MOOSE simulation. How can I ensure that it is only called once?
I am using a GeneralUserObject
thanks!
I've used pybind11 + user object for this, it's not trivial to setup but no real gotchas either.

Hi,
thanks, great idea! Are you willing to share your code?
